channel.title: My New GUI
channel.description:
Well I Got A new GUI Coming Out But Im Having Trouble Adding The Button to Work can someone help me
P.s i followed Frells tutorial
Thanks frell ;)
And the other thing i want to run it from a jar file how would i do this

item.title: My New GUI
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

frank_:

what the hell of the point of making a gui when you dont have a program that needs a gui

to learn about making GUIs,
if someone needs practice writing event-based things, or how to use different layout managers, making a “useless” GUI is very useful.

Read full topic

item.title: My New GUI
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Good point[quote=“eVokki`, post:20, topic:181150”]E-PENIS[/quote]
Good point.

I recommend you include a timer to see how long init is and maybe even hijack the event queue so you can output how long each event takes to process. It really doesn’t matter that writing to the console how long it took will take longer than the action itself. Just make sure you use the nanosecond timer as this gives the highest degree of precision and so result in the longest penis.

Read full topic

nospam

Frell:

I admit i was helping people start off, I dont know everything, most of the things in that tutorial i new then. Most people find long confusing tutorials and i just made mine short and sweet, and it worked for most people.

Put it simply, it sucked.

item.title: My New GUI
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:15, topic:181150”]Did you not notice ‘simple’ in the tutorial title? Wasn’t supposed to be on all GUI information. And you over exaggerate alot. And it all worked in the tutorial, everyone said so, it may have been nooby, yes, but its also almost a year old and that was all i really knew, i saw no others so i figured it would be fun.

But ill consider going back through it and making it more understandable with what i now know.[/quote]

Don’t consider, ever. Do or do not.

I may seem to over exaggerate, but I am simply stressing the importance of factual and accurate information. I never accused the tutorial of the lack to work. I said that you should fully learn the subject before you teach it to others. Do not think you know something, KNOW you know something. If you go around posting tutorials with only your own assumptions and gatherings, those who actually spent the time to do what you did plus what you did not (which is reading the actual java tutorials) will be able to criticize you for lack of conventions and lack of the proper use of the api. If you do not understand what I am getting at, then please spend the next month reviewing the basics and gui tutorials on http://java.sun.com/

Read full topic

item.title: My New GUI
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Did you not notice ‘simple’ in the tutorial title? Wasn’t supposed to be on all GUI information. And you over exaggerate alot. And it all worked in the tutorial, everyone said so, it may have been nooby, yes, but its also almost a year old and that was all i really knew, i saw no others so i figured it would be fun.

But ill consider going back through it and making it more understandable with what i now know.

Read full topic

item.title: My New GUI
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:13, topic:181150”]Yes my tutorial is good except for the end, that was a rush due to something i left out. but that should be the only part thats hard to understand. and my tutorial wasn’t 100% for people who have never seen java before (outside of mscp). Tico doesn’t know the difference, he saw lawl say that my tutorial is crap because it explained everything he knew how to do. plus, it was made almost a year ago.

Frell, I will put it as it is. You posted a tutorial that is bollocks. So in my opinion, Tico135 has done the kid a favour by giving him a link to a good tutorial.

Favor* and the kid who posted the one in Ticos link looked at my tutorial and explained everything i didn’t (everything i didnt know at the time), thus making it better[/quote]

If you cannot take criticism, leave or don’t post tutorials. Secondly, your tutorial was you trying to teach others how to make a gui when you recently figured it out yourself. You don’t make tutorials on things you full, and I mean fully understand the topic at hand. If you don’t do this you could teach the person reading false information which could fault up their entire future learning in that subject. Then later on, they will have to relearn those parts (which can be a hassle in the beginning parts) just to continue on their learning.

By the way, Frell, I am not attacking you. I am pointing out the truth. I do not want to argue, so do not bother making a retort. This is the unmistakable truth of making tutorials and that is that.

Read full topic

@Frell wrote:

Tico135:

Well, first off, you followed Frell’s tutorial, there’s your problem. It isn’t exactly the best. If you need help with GUI’s, I suggest this, it goes over the same things, but more explained and quite easy to understand. If you are having problem with a button, try telling us what you are trying to do.

@ saint
My tutorial is a bit wack now that i realise it, but it explains it, it all works, you might of had trouble understanding.

@ tico
gbt mscp. I dont see you making any tutorials.
